notesDEID:
Subjective:
Patient reports intermittent abdominal pain and occasional bloody stools.
Complains of fatigue and easy bruising.
States that he has been compliant with his aminosalicylic acid regimen.
Objective:
Vital Signs: BP 120/80 mmHg, HR 75 bpm, Temp 98.6ï¿½F, RR 16 breaths/min
Abdominal exam: mild tenderness in the left lower quadrant, no palpable masses.
Blood tests:
Hemoglobin: 10.5 g/dL (low)
White blood cell count: 15,000/mm_ (elevated)
Platelet count: 450,000/mm_ (elevated)
Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR): 35 mm/hr (elevated)
Colonoscopy: Presence of inflammatory polyps in the colon.
Bone marrow biopsy: Hypercellular marrow consistent with chronic myeloproliferative disease.
Assessment:
Inflammatory Polyps of the Colon
Chronic Myeloproliferative Disease
Plan:
Inflammatory Polyps of the Colon:
Continue aminosalicylic acid 4000 MG daily.
Schedule a follow-up colonoscopy in 6 months to assess the response to treatment.
Consider adding a short course of steroids if symptoms worsen.
Recommend a diet low in processed foods and high in fiber.
Chronic Myeloproliferative Disease:
Refer to a hematologist for further evaluation and management.
Consider starting hydroxyurea to control elevated white blood cell and platelet counts.
Monitor blood counts every 3 months.
Educate patient on the signs and symptoms of worsening disease, such as increased fatigue, bleeding, or bruising.
General:
Encourage adequate hydration and a balanced diet.
Educate patient on the importance of regular follow-up visits.
Provide information on support groups for patients with chronic illnesses.
